newsitem.title: USA: US cash gasoline jumps, distillates slip on ACCESS.
newsitem.headline: US cash gasoline jumps, distillates slip on ACCESS.

text.p: U.S. spot gasoline jumped sharply while distillates edged lower in after-hours ACCESS trade Tuesday, players said, following weekly API data showing a solid draw on gasoline stocks and a slim decline on distillates.

November heating oil futures slipped about 0.20 cent in ACCESS activity as the market digested data showing a 17,000 barrel decline in total U.S. distillate stocks, but a bearish 2.5 million barrel distillate build in the key Northeast heating market.
The Northeast build included a 1.3 million barrel gain in low sulfur diesel and a 1.2 million barrel increase in heating oil inventories for the week ending October 18.

Distillate prices had risen about 0.20 cent in earlier NYMEX trading in part because of Colonial Pipeline's announcement yesterday that it would allocate nominations through late November. But differentials held steady, traders said.

"There's room for distillates to slide another three or four cents more because of the Colonial situation," one Gulf Coast trader said. "Any time you have allocations there's a good chance of distressed barrels."
